page.title: 07The Shah Jehan Mosque,Woking
page.content: The Mosque was built in 1889 by Dr. Gottlieb Wilhelm Leitner. It was the first mosque to be built in England and served the Asian community in London as well as local Muslims. It is situated in Oriental Road. The building is made from Bath and Bargate stone and the design came from other Oriental mosques. It has an onion shaped green dome. The Indian Muslims worship there. The Imam preaches and teaches the Muslims from the Koran, their Holy Book. There are about seven hundred Muslims in Woking, most of whom live in the Maybury area. It is very common to see whole families in their national dress. Many of the men work as shop-keepers or in local factories.
